strength.name: Strength
strength.summary: Strength represents a creature's muscular and physical power, and its ability to fight in melee combat. In a harrowing, it more broadly symbolizes war, battle, and honor.

cards.name: The Paladin
cards.desc: Standing resolutely against trouble, without backing down.

cards.name: The Keep
cards.desc: Quiet, unshakeable strength that withstands any hardship.

cards.name: The Big Sky
cards.desc: Momentous change, as when all the slaves of a nation are emancipated.

cards.name: The Forge
cards.desc: Strength through diversity, or strength from many sources united against a single trial.

cards.name: The Bear
cards.desc: Pure strength that cannot be truly tamed or trained.

cards.name: The Uprising
cards.desc: Overwhelming strength that catches the subject up in something much more powerful.

cards.name: The Fiend
cards.desc: A devil who devours the masses of the innocent, and can represent the deaths of many in a disaster.

cards.name: The Beating
cards.desc: An assault from all quarters, or the mental dissolution of the self.

cards.name: The Cyclone
cards.desc: An unstoppable, destructive force unleashed through the plots of intelligent creatures.

dexterity.name: Dexterity
dexterity.summary: Dexterity represents a creature's agility, reflexes, balance, and skill with ranged weapons. In a harrowing, it more broadly symbolizes trouble, children, and entertainment.

cards.name: The Dance
cards.desc: A complicated framework that requires the cooperation of all to avoid collapse.

cards.name: The Cricket
cards.desc: The grig, quick travel, and the reward at the end of a journey.

cards.name: The Juggler
cards.desc: Destiny, deities, and those who play with the fates of others.

cards.name: The Locksmith
cards.desc: The keys the subject needs to unlock his fate. The card grants the tools needed to unlock some new place, puzzle, or hoard.

cards.name: The Peacock
cards.desc: A great beauty that can only be preserved if petrified and frozen in time for eternity, as by a cockatrice's glare.

cards.name: The Rabbit Prince
cards.desc: The quirky vicissitudes of melee combat. The Rabbit Prince is the personification of the capriciousness of battle, and his broken sword indicates that defeat can come to anyone. The card sometimes represents younger members of royal or noble houses.[

cards.name: The Avalanche
cards.desc: Disaster: an unthinking panic and destruction that overruns all.[

cards.name: The Crows
cards.desc: Murder, theft, and the violent loss of that which is loved.[

cards.name: The Demon's Lantern
cards.desc: An impossible situation of traps, mind tricks, and sleight of hand.[

constitution.name: Constitution
constitution.summary: Constitution represents a creature's health, stamina, and increased ability to survive injuries or disease. In a harrowing, it more broadly symbolizes health, the home, and pain.

cards.name: The Trumpet
cards.desc: An archon who dives aggressively and righteously into danger.

cards.name: The Survivor
cards.desc: A creature that has managed to survive a terrible ordeal, when everyone thought him lost.

cards.name: The Desert
cards.desc: An environment too difficult for anyone to survive without help. The sphinx may represent a source of salvation from plague.

cards.name: The Brass Dwarf
cards.desc: A creature invulnerable to a current threat.

cards.name: The Teamster
cards.desc: An external force that drives the subject on.

cards.name: The Mountain Man
cards.desc: An encounter with a physical power outside of the subject's control.

cards.name: The Tangled Briar
cards.desc: A historical thing or creature that will have some influence on the question.

cards.name: The Sickness
cards.desc: Corruption, famine, plague, pestilence, and disease.

cards.name: The Waxworks
cards.desc: A place of torture, imprisonment, helplessness, and paralysis.

intelligence.name: Intelligence
intelligence.summary: Intelligence represents a creature's ability to learn and reason, and can indicate facility with languages or arcane magic. In a harrowing, it more broadly symbolizes money, school, and literature.

cards.name: The Hidden Truth
cards.desc: TThe discovery of the greater truth within.

cards.name: The Wanderer
cards.desc: A centaur collector who appreciates things others discard as junk.

cards.name: The Joke
cards.desc: A monster that can only be defeated through trickery, or the value of humor in circumventing difficult people.

cards.name: The Inquisitor
cards.desc: An immutable object that cannot be deceived or influenced.

cards.name: The Foreign Trader
cards.desc: Spies, merchants, and those who trade in information.

cards.name: The Vision
cards.desc: Esoteric and arcane knowledge, or madness.

cards.name: The Rakshasa
cards.desc: Domination, mental control, and slavery.

cards.name: The Idiot
cards.desc: Folly, greed, blackmail, bribery, or hubris.

cards.name: The Snakebite
cards.desc: Poison, venom, assassination, and discord.

wisdom.name: Wisdom
wisdom.summary: Wisdom represents a creature's willpower, common sense, awareness, intuition, and perception, and can indicate facility with divine magic. In a harrowing, it more broadly symbolizes ancient history, morality, and the gods.

cards.name: The Winged Serpent
cards.desc: The couatl, the bridge of understanding between the towers of knowledge and judgement.

cards.name: The Midwife
cards.desc: The enabler or conduit of new creation, information, or arrivals.

cards.name: The Publican
cards.desc: Fellowship and refuge. The cyclops is a seemingly inconsequential figure who nonetheless has relevant insight.

cards.name: The Queen Mother
cards.desc: This formian is the personification of knowledge, who is fond of the powerless, the underclass, and those who will show her obeisance.

cards.name: The Owl
cards.desc: The harsh wisdom of the natural order. The owl holds a needle that can bind life together or pick it apart.

cards.name: The Carnival
cards.desc: Illusions and false dreams.

cards.name: The Eclipse
cards.desc: Loss of faith and purpose, and the subject's doubt about his abilities or prospects.

cards.name: The Mute Hag
cards.desc: The insightful hag, a purveyor of blood pacts, treacherous secrets, and discord.

cards.name: The Lost
cards.desc: The permanently insane, lost among lunatics and psychopaths in insane asylums. It is a card of emptiness.

charisma.name: Charisma
charisma.summary: Charisma represents a creature's personality, personal magnetism, ability to lead, and appearance, and can indicate facility with spontaneously cast magic. In a harrowing, it more broadly symbolizes love, family, and politics.

cards.name: The Empty Throne
cards.desc: Those who are gone, or a ghost of the past that has taught important lessons.

cards.name: The Theater
cards.desc: Prophecy, with a true prophet acting a part as the puppet of the gods.

cards.name: The Unicorn
cards.desc: One who generously offers up that which is sought.

cards.name: The Marriage
cards.desc: A union of peoples, ideas, or kingdoms that might be as productive or as ruinous as the bonding of a salamander and a water weird.

cards.name: The Twin
cards.desc: Duality of purpose or identity, or indecision and fence-sitting for the subject or the entire spread.

cards.name: The Courtesan
cards.desc: Political intrigue and the superficiality of social niceties.

cards.name: The Tyrant
cards.desc: A ruler who harms those he rules.

cards.name: The Betrayal
cards.desc: Selfishness and envy.

cards.name: The Liar
cards.desc: Destructive, treacherous love. The lamia signals obsession, star-crossed lovers, or unrequited des
